description: Launching brings up a command prompt screen for a few seconds, flashes some words too quick to read then it disappears. This is all I could get it to do.

Find a video you want to download. In your browser, right click and select "copy video URL" or "copy video location". Open your files and go to the file where you want to download your video. Right click in your file and select "Open in Terminal." In Terminal type the following: youtube-dl Add a space after what you just typed and right click to paste the link you just copied into Terminal. Here is an example: youtube-dl video-to-download.mp4
Hit Enter and your video should start downloading. If it does not download you may have selected the wrong link in your browser or the video is protected somehow. You may be able to update youtube-dl to work around this problem.

Hey i was wondering how do you update the 'youtube-dl' thingy so i can dwnload videos and music on YT? 

Hope to hear from someone soon
